info.name: Red nucleus
info.description: The red nucleus is a large, round nucleus in the tegmentum of the midbrain that appears pink or red on freshly-sectioned tissue. It is involved with motor control via its connections with the cerebellum. It receives contralateral input from both the dentate and interposed deep cerebellar nuclei; its primary output in the human is to the ipsilateral inferior olivary nucleus via the central tegmental tract. Since the inferior olivary nucleus projects to contralateral cerebellum, the red nucleus is part of a feedback loop to the cerebellum. While the red nucleus gives origin to a significant rubrospinal tract in non-human species, this tract appears to be of limited extent and importance in humans.
